answers.answer: Did your doctor run tests on you?  The main problems with erections involve the circulatory system (blood flow), the nervous system (nerve function), and hormones.Diabetes is a very common disease that can cause the first two problems, so your doctor needs to check you for that.  Also look at your cholesterol and triglyceride numbers.  If those are out of the good range you are likely to have vascular issues from that.  If you smoke, you will not have good vascular function.  If you have back problems, that can cause problems with nerves to the area.  You need to find out the cause of the problem so that can be treated.  Then your erections should improve as your health does, but you can also add a drug like Viagra to help optimize things.  There are other options that a urologist could describe to you once the major health issues are taken care of.Here is a helpful article for you.http://www.psychtreatment.com/cause_of_male_impotence.htm

question: my girl thinks i dont like her becose when we do it i lose or blow it. i think im going to lose her becose of it my doctor keeps saying im to young to have these problems. what do i doThis discussion is related to Loss of erection during intercourse.
title: hates being singal
